intro: Cacalia corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. Cacalia corymbosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and ease of care.
